item.title: Toyota posts nearly 20% drop in second-quarter operating profit, missing estimates
item.description: Despite the lower takings, Toyota had raised its interim and full year dividend forecast

item.title: Tesla jumps in overnight trading as Trump-backer Musk seen benefiting
item.description: Shares of Tesla gained as investors priced in the likelihood of a Donald Trump victory.

item.title: Japan plans ‘conveyor belt road’ linking Tokyo and Osaka amid delivery driver shortage
item.description:
It is hoped ‘innovative’ 24-hour design will also cut carbon emissions, as demand for delivery services soars

Six decades after the bullet train first whisked passengers between Tokyo and Osaka, authorities in Japan are planning to do the same for cargo, with the construction of a “conveyor belt road”.

The automated cargo transport corridor, which will connect the capital with Osaka, 320 miles (515km) away, is seen as part of the solution to soaring demand for delivery services in the world’s fourth-biggest economy.

Continue reading...

item.title: Truck driver tells William Tyrrell inquest he saw car ‘acting suspiciously’ on day of boy’s disappearance
item.description:
Peter Bashkurt tells court the car ‘caught my attention’ because it was being driven erratically

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcast

A truck driver has testified that he saw a car that was “acting suspiciously” the day William Tyrrell disappeared on the mid-north coast of New South Wales, on 12 September 2014.

The inquest into the disappearance of the toddler entered its third day on Wednesday, with truck driver Peter Bashkurt saying he saw a dark Toyota Camry twice on the day three-year-old Tyrrell vanished.

Sign up for Guardian Australia’s breaking news email
